title: Daily reminder that ARAM should include the entire champion pool
body: That way people can't make ARAM only accounts and completely dominate the other team.

replies.body:
Indeed.

-No trades
-No rerolls
-Full champ pool

Oh no, that game that advertises itself as random is now actually somewhat random. And for fuck's sake, remove snowballs.

But a team with good regen and enough tanks/hard engage would destroy this team, because as soon as they get 3000hp and 200 magic resist, Xerath, Ziggs and Lux are all doing tiny amounts of poke, and are squishy snacks.

I've found it's best to have 2 tanks on a team to cause absolute havoc with the enemy backline and completely shutdown their damage from the mid game. If you also have someone to sustain them like Alistair or Soraka, then it's really really tough going.

Depends on how much waveclear/sustain the other team has. If the other team doesn't have either, there's a decent chance the poke team could end the game before the other team has the raw stats to engage.

But why would people go through the trouble of creating a separate account just for aram? It's like the least competitive mode. Sometimes the enemy team has a better comp but who cares, it's aram
Tryhards, man. They're everywhere...
Out of curiosity, why is ARAM the "least competitive mode"?
only because you can't get shiny bits of ribbon from there

It's because it's mostly played by people who just want to have a fun interactive game where the stakes are basically nothing.  It's action packed from beginning to end, and even if you lose it's like 15 minutes of your life, not much.

Because there's no strategy to it. It's fun, but you can't decide if you're going to play a champ that's good or not, or if you're going to get a team comp that works together. There's also no strategy in the game because it's just push, or wait for allies to join you and push.

It's not balanced and isn't intended to be, it's supposed to be less competitive fun where you use champs you might not normally use.

It's really not. I didn't do it on purpose but on my smurf, I only have Teemo and Veigar to play in pvp. I've had the account for years but about 2 months ago, I played aram for the first time and got Veigar. Stun wasn't worth a lick of salt against tanks who can still run in and bash my face in afterward.

It might be great against squishies, but if the enemy has tanks, they'll take the stun and keep on trucking.

You know those ARAM accounts with those crazy poke champs like Nid and Xerath or the cheese champs like Yi actually really suck late game against a normal account that has tanks and peel to pick from.
Except when that team doesn't roll tanks or for some reason people reroll ALL their tanks.
Well then that puts you on par with all the supposed ARAM accounts you're going against.

Could not agree more. I don't know about everyone else, but I actually started to avoid ARAM some weeks just because some of the champs that are OP in ARAM are available. It would be better just to make them all available and with Hex teck crafting coming, make it so you can use those essence shards to get an extra re-roll. 
That would encourage people to play the normal mode while giving another way to earn a re-roll aside from just playing ARAM repeatedly.

More importantly, they just need to do a better job of balancing teams.  It seems like it wouldn't be that hard for Riot to just a assign a 1-5 score to each champ based on ARAM effectiveness and then pick the teams pseudo-randomly, making sure the total score is even or close to it, or just making sure there are even numbers of ranged champs, tanks, etc.  It feels like the majority of games are decided before the game even starts simply because the teams can end up being so unbalanced.

ARAM is not meant to be balanced.

It's a joke mode for screwing around with your buddies when you're too drunk/tired/annoyed to play real matches.

I'm not saying to make it balanced.

I'm saying make it somewhat fair...

Would you want, on your joke mode, tryhards who end up with a bunch of long range seige champs/healers on their team while you get completely curbstomped?

This change makes it more fun for everyone.
